intro: Dracaena ueleensis, commonly known as the Uele dracaena, is a species of flowering plant native to the Democratic Republic of the Congo. It belongs to the Asparagaceae family and is characterized by its upright, cylindrical stem and narrow, strap-like leaves. The plant produces small, greenish-white flowers that are typically clustered in inflorescences. Dracaena ueleensis is adapted to grow in tropical and subtropical climates, often found in moist, shaded environments. Its unique morphology and limited distribution make it an interesting subject for botanical study.
